task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target, align the circular end-effector, push the block rightward in short strokes until it sits within the target outline, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a circular end-effector pushes a T-shaped block across a flat table into a marked target outline. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception of both the block and the goal area, alignment of tool yaw to push direction, and incremental pushes to manage stick–slip and orientation drift. Short waits between pushes allow state observation at 10 Hz, while conservative timeouts ensure safety. The scene contains the robot, a red T block, and a blue target outline on a white tabletop.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-block and the marked target area
Robot is homed and reachable to both block and target
End-effector is circular and suitable for pushing
stepwise_plan: Detect the T-block; if not visible, scan in a spiral.
Detect the target area; if not visible, scan in a spiral.
Move above the block and refine alignment.
Set yaw to match push direction (0° ≈ right).
Execute repeated short pushes with brief waits to stabilize.
After reaching the target outline, retreat.
success_criteria: T-block lies fully within the target outline
No collision with fixtures; block orientation acceptable
Robot ends in a safe, retracted pose
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → spiral scan and retry
Misalignment or slipping during push → re-align and continue next cycle
Overshoot past target → re-detect and push back (not shown but feasible)
task_long_description.termination: Tree finishes after the retreat once push cycles complete without errors.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear tool–block contact with alignment normal to push direction.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation likely; confirms goal direction toward the right-hand target.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-block is visible.
Searches for the T-block with a spiral scan.
Checks if the goal outline is visible.
Searches for the goal area with a spiral scan.
Moves above the block at a safe height.
Refines lateral approach and alignment for pushing.
Orients the tool to push toward 0° (right).
Executes a short push toward the target.
Backs off to a safe pose after placement.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to glare or occlusion
recovery_strategy: Fallback to spiral scan when visibility checks fail
Re-run ApproachAndAlign before next push cycle
Use multiple short pushes with waits for stability
If overshoot detected, reverse push direction (not encoded here)
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue target outline; colors differ from the instruction (gray/green). Frames are treated as authoritative.
Push direction approximated as 0° (rightward) based on frame motion (0→6).
10 Hz observation/control implied via short waits and moderate timeouts; no explicit frequency port exists in the library.

expected_success_criteria: Final position of the T-block fully within the goal outline
Tool retreats clear of the block
